page.title: 09HENRY TRIGG OF STEVENAGE
page.content: { {HENRY TRIGG}was not a poor man and he made his living as a grocer.One night Henry and two freinds saw a band of body snatchers snatching a body that had just been experimented on.So when he died he was put on the rafters of his barn so he had less chance of getting his body snatched.He had strange ideas and whims. The barn at the back of his house is now a bank called{National Westminster}.When he died his will was to give his relations 10 shillings each and good freinds got 5 shillings.{Henry}was a church warden at St {Nicholas church. It is still possible to see the old coffin in the rafters of a small barn at rear of the Bank though the remains of old Henry have been removed.
